title: The Scottish Varsity
text:
The Scottish Varsity, also known as <a href="The%20Royal%20Bank%20of%20Scotland">The Royal Bank of Scotland</a> Scottish Varsity Match, is an annual <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> fixture between the <a href="University%20of%20St%20Andrews%20RFC">University of St Andrews</a> and the <a href="Edinburgh%20University%20RFC">University of Edinburgh</a> in <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>. The universities are both founders of the <a href="Scottish%20Rugby%20Union">Scottish Rugby Union</a> and varsity fixtures have been held since the 1860s, laying claim to the title of the "world's oldest varsity match". 
The Scottish Varsity was resurrected in 2011 after a hiatus of over 50 years and was staged in London at the home of <a href="London%20Scottish%20F.C.">London Scottish RFC</a> in order to build alumni relations. In 2015, the match returned to Scotland in <a href="Murrayfield%20Stadium">Murrayfield Stadium</a> and drew a crowd of over 10,000 spectators. In 2021, the match was played at <a href="University%20Park%2C%20St%20Andrews">University Park</a>, the home of <a href="University%20of%20St%20Andrews%20RFC">University of St Andrews RFC</a>, due to Covid-19 pandemic crowd restrictions. The match is normally held in late September and has received coverage from <a href="Sky%20Sports">Sky Sports</a>, the <a href="BBC">BBC</a> and IRB’s Total Rugby.
Men's Results.
Varsity matches were initially held on <a href="St.%20Andrew%27s%20Day">St. Andrew's Day</a> but have been moved earlier to late September, they have attracted notable attendees including her <a href="Anne%2C%20Princess%20Royal">Royal Highness Princess Anne</a> in 2012.
Women's Results.
In 2014, the inaugural Women's Varsity Match took place in the form of a 7-a-side match. It now continues to take place every year as a 15-a-side match.
